data.title: OK if you're in the area
data.text:
Had heard about this spot from an AZ Republic post on FB. We were in the area early on a Saturday evening.  Small and inviting place, obviously family run. Pizza supposedly the feature but a lot of patrons eating other dishes. 

We had two different pizzas and a spaghetti & meatballs.  Regina pizza with added sausage was fine, although needed salt and was also pretty wet.  Tasty though. Wifey had a Bianca with added Gaeta olives...which turned out to NOT be Gaeta variety.  Having owned a fine dining Italian restaurant, I know my olives...and Gaetas are NOT green.  The server insisted they were but I let it slide as I wasn't in the mood to argue. 

Kids spaghetti was very flavorful, and al dente.  The meatball to rather meat patty (it was flat) was fried, then had sauce dribbled on it, not cooked in the sauce.  Flavor was good but a bit chewy.  

Service was OK.  I suspect the regulars get more attention, but that's not a surprise.

All in all, good if you're in the area but I wouldn't go far out of my way. 

GB

data.title: Perfect
data.text: Dulce diavolo is the best pizza topping I have ever had.  Sweet. Spicy.  Fresh.  Just yummy.   Everyone loved their food but mine was best!   Highly recommended!

data.title: Another great meal at La Piazza al Forno!  Always good!
data.text: We have eaten here several times.  The food is always good as well as the service.  The Pizza is amazing.  Everything I have ever tried is good.  We went with our daughters family (which includes 3 children) and everyone left happy and full.  Will definitely go back again.

data.title: Best Neopolitan Artisan Pizza
data.text: Great pizzas certified authentic Neopolitan pizzas, but don't overlook the other items on their menu. All are delicious. Nice ambience and great service. Family owned by local family.

data.title: PIZZA HEAVEn
data.text: Visited this small establishment on Saturday night. Ordered the Italian Stallion. The pizza was excellent. Small but awesome. We ended up ordering another. The two pies fed four adults perfect.  Would highly recommend this  restaurant

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: We live down the street, brick oven, fresh ingredients and friendly staff equals great time. Everything we have had has been excellent. Sometimes we just go for dessert. Can get full, early dinner or lunch is not as crowded.

data.title: Authentic brick oven pizza
data.text: Delicious thin crust with great toppings. We were told the "Itallion Stallion" was their best seller and you can see why. Delicious! The Margheurita was excellent as well, lots of gooey mozzarella and very tasty sauce. They serve Coke in glass bottles, no high fructose corn syrup, it says sugar on the label. How rare.

data.title: A storefront in downtown Glendale AZ
data.text: La Piazza al Forno distinguishes itself with their brick oven pizza's, however, like politics and religion, not all are in agreement that this rather small thin crust variety is the best. Being from Chicago, via NY, I crave something that I can chew on that is filling and not too unreasonably priced and is sized for leftovers. For that reason I typically order their wonderful dinner entrees such as chicken marsala and baked lasagna. I believe they are finished in the brick oven giving them a wonderful flavor. The restaurant is quite casual and the staff is cordial and helpful. The location is very convenient when attending The Brelby Theatre around the corner. Street and lot parking is ample and free during the evening.

data.title: Awesome!!!!!
data.text: Great pizza!  Will definitely be back, one visit and it's our new go to pizza place.  Didn't care much for the Zeppolis but next time I'll order the cheese cake.

data.title: Traditional Pizza Made the Traditional Way:  Hand Tossed and in a Wood Fired Oven
data.text:
We stopped at La Piazza Al Forno for lunch on our way to the Arizona Cardinals
 preseason practice.  I had seen an episode of DDD on the Food Network featuring this restaurant so decided we should go and taste some good traditionally made food.

We had the lunch special pizza.  We watched the pizza creator toss the dough to form the crust and after he had the toppings on it we saw him put it into the wood fired oven.

A few minutes later and we were eating delicious pizza.  Needless to say, by the time we were done, mainly myself, there was nothing left.  Some people leave the edges of the crust behind, I didn't and I doubt if many people do, that's how good this crust was.

We were so full that we didn't have any of the great food at the football stadium and they do have good food there.

data.title: Not your average Pizza
data.text: This is pizza the way it should be prepared.  Salads are excellent and compliment the pizza.  Service is very good, very attentive without hovering.  Nice selection of Italian soda.

data.title: Best antipasto in Arizona
data.text: What a gem. I've had Margarita pizza in Naples and this resturant rivals the best that Italy has to offer. Great service and a dynamic menu filled with wonderful  options. Don't miss the antipasto for two . It has no rivals

data.title: Local hotspot
data.text: The make their own cheese...what's not to love?  This is a small, quaint little restaurant tucked into Old Glendale.  The pizza is fantastic and I love the atmosphere.  The restaurant is small and doesn't take reservations, and the line can be out the door.  Guy Fieri (Diners, Drive-ins and Dives) even visited the establishment!

data.title: mamma mia that's tasty
data.text: I love this place.  I am immediately transported to a small Italian diner with red wine flowing and a slight haze of flour in the air.  I love the thin crust and the family atmosphere.

data.title: Awesome hidden gem in Downtown Glendale
data.text: Fantastic antipasto salad and brick oven pizza to die for... Not to mention their fried ravioli! Scrumptious. Small and quaint venue. I highly recommend!

data.title: Local Gem!
data.text: Excellent pizza and pasta in a charming environment! We've tried several different pizza, each one has been better than the last.  It can be difficult to find a table during busy dinner hours so come early, well worth it!

data.title: Exceptional
data.text: By far the best pizza in the Phoenix area. One of our favorite places to visit. The pasta dishes and salads are also very good. The white pizza and linguine with clam sauce are my favorite.

data.title: Excellent Pizza - Return Traveler!!
data.text: Wonderful pizza sicilian style.  Can't say enough about this place.  It is great.  You must go.  Got their version of meat lovers.  Small pizza was plenty for two people.

data.title: What Pizzeria Bianco wishes they could be!!!
data.text: Excellent pizza and pastas!  We had the Rigatoni Al Forno pasta and the Italian Stallion pizza. Both were delicious! Sandi was a wonderful waitress. This place can get busy on weekends so be prepared for a possible wait, but its definitely worth it. A hidden gem in downtown Glendale.

data.title: Known For Pizza .. The Pasta/Salad are excellent, too.
data.text:
Had a broth based chicken pasta with Rigatoni and couldn't shovel it in fast enough.  That was preceded by the house specialty salad with greens, Parmesan, salami, and olives in a just right sweet vinaigrette.  Unbelievably good.
This place always is.
Go there.
Now.
Warning -- they get three bucks for a can of Diet Coke.  That seems a bit harsh.
